title: Herb & Dorothy 50X50 (2013)

cast.name: Joel Dinglasan
cast.character: Himself - Physical Therapist, Kinetic Sports Physical Therapy P.C.

cast.name: Patrick Duffy
cast.character: Himself - Board President, Las Vegas Art Museum

cast.name: Ruth Fine
cast.character: Herself - Curator, National Gallery of Art

cast.name: Stephan Jost
cast.character: Himself - Director, Honolulu Museum of Art

cast.name: Max Marmor
cast.character: Himself - President, Samuel H. Kress Foundation

cast.name: Robyn G. Peterson
cast.character: Herself - Executive Director, Yellowstone Art Museum

cast.character: Himself - Curator, Virginia Museum of Fine Arts

cast.name: Danielle Rice
cast.character: Herself - Executive Director, Delaware Art Museum

cast.name: Jerry Schefcik
cast.character: Himself - Director, Donna Beam Fine Art Gallery UNLV

cast.name: Gail Stavitsky
cast.character: Herself - Chief Curator, Montclair Art Museum

cast.name: Jason Stieber
cast.character: Himself - Collections Specialist, Archives of American Art

overview: A follow up to award winning documentary 'Herb & Dorothy', the film captures the ordinary couple's extraordinary gift of art to the nation as they close the door on their life as collectors. When Herb and Dorothy Vogel, a retired postal clerk and librarian, began collecting works of contemporary art in the 1960s, they never imagined it would outgrow their one bedroom Manhattan apartment and spread throughout America. 50 years later, the collection is nearly 5,000 pieces and worth millions. Refusing to sell, the couple launches an unprecedented gift project giving artworks to one museum in all 50 states. The film journeys around the country with the Vogels, meeting artists who are famous or unknown, often controversial, striking today's society with questions about art and its survival.
